channel.title: Peter O'Shaughnessy
channel.description: Tech geek, web developer and advocate

item.description: The W3C Working Group has been busy developing new standards to help make online payments much easier.

item.description: Some tips for avoiding burnout in Developer Relations roles...

item.description: VR is much more than just gaming. Let’s take a look at some different kinds of VR applications...

item.description: As usual with the Web, it’s up to you to choose and combine the technologies in the best way you see fit...

item.description: Seeing a tweet yesterday reminded me that a lot of developers still believe the Web would be better if we had One Browser To Rule Them All...

item.description: Rolling out over the next few days, featuring DeX support, PWA ambient badging, Physical Web and more!

item.description: Our traditional idea of the top five browsers may be over-simplified, outdated and skewed.

item.description: Imagine you’re hurrying towards your bus stop in the pouring rain (not an unlikely scenario here in London 😉). You dive under the shelter…

item.description: It’s 2017 — a decade on from the launch of the iPhone. What has become of the web, and what is it becoming?

item.title: How to take payments on the web with the Payment Request API
item.description: Paying for things online can be a pain, can’t it? You keep having to type out the same card details and contact details. It’s especially a pain on mobile...

item.description: Hey, remember QR codes? Those magical black and white squares that convey information and URLs...

item.title: The ‘Hype Pendulum’ of Web Development

item.title: Is browser still the right word?
item.description: With the rise of progressive web app technologies, web browsers are more capable than ever. So much so, that the word “browser” doesn’t really fit anymore.

item.title: Bytes Conf 2016 and spreading the word about PWAs
item.description: I was fortunate enough to be one of the speakers at BytesConf, where I spoke about PWAs and Samsung Internet.

item.title: Highlights from Google's Progressive Web Apps Training in London
item.description: Google kindly invited us to “Building Progressive Web Apps”, a 3-day PWA bootcamp covering service workers, push notifications, Web Payments, responsive design and more.

item.title: How are Progressive Web Apps helping communities and businesses?
item.description: Web developers have probably heard lots of buzz about PWAs by now, but why are they important? I'm collecting together stories and examples of how they have helped people, communities and businesses.

item.title: Things I learned making a Progressive Web App for super selfies
item.description: A simple demo turned into a lot of learning about service workers, client-side image downloads and more.

item.title: If Leicester win the league, it will be a victory for hackers and tinkerers everywhere

item.title: Web Bluetooth - Controlling the Real World from your Browser
item.description: The Connected Devices revolution, why I believe Web Bluetooth is the most exciting new browser API, and why drone flipping is my new favourite use of JavaScript.

item.description: “There’s nothing you can’t do if you get the habits right.”

item.title: Robots, Virtual Reality and the Internet of Things? I Can't Believe It's JavaScript!
